pages.text: While a botanist often prefers a warm climate, there are still some aspects of colder spaces that can prove useful. One such aspect is the fact that water will freeze allowing for the collection of $(item)Ice$() and $(item)Snowballs$(). The $(item)Freezer$() uses $(aura) to bring the cold to warm places. It will cool down all the surrounding blocks. Turning water into $(item)Ice$() and leaving $(item)Snow$() on the ground where it can.

The $(item)Freezer$() cool down the area even more when it is provided with a $(thing)redstone signal$(). This makes the $(item)Ice$() it generates hard enough to be gathered with more brute force than usual. This does come at a greater $(aura) cost.
